column4: i cant connect to the internet on my ubuntu box, can someone please help me
I noticed, and you can't get IP addresses, etc?
my /etc/network/interfaces file only has one entry, the one for the loopback
sounds like your wired chipset doesn't have a driver
does have auto lo sorry, then the loopback.  am I simply out of luck or is there anywhere I can search for a driver?
you'd have to search for the driver most likely, which ubuntu are you using anyway?
weird, do you have any other ways to access the internet on that same machine that is having issues
have a wireless card however that's not working either, a dlink dwa 552.
funny its supposed to work, that wireless card
i click the connection menu i have access to "Connect to Hidden Wireless Network"  however there's no entry in interfaces, should I manually add something to it?
check to see if ath9k is loaded under lspci -nnk
I do see my ethernet controller in there
hmm the wireless card needs to be plugged in, maybe you need to manually modprobe the driver for wireless
thanks for all your help, i'm going to look into this some more tomorrow.
